pains: How can Whatfix help us reduce costs and enhance efficiency in our healthcare operations?
What are the implementation timelines and resource requirements for Whatfix?
How can we measure the ROI of using Whatfix for our digital adoption needs?
Will Whatfix be able to integrate with our existing healthcare systems and applications?
How does Whatfix ensure data security and compliance with healthcare regulations?
Can Whatfix provide customized solutions for our specific healthcare use cases?
How does Whatfix handle complex workflows and business processes in healthcare?
What kind of support and training does Whatfix offer for our end-users and administrators?
objections: We have a tight budget for new software implementations, and Whatfix may be too expensive for us.
We are already using other digital adoption platforms, and we're not sure if Whatfix is the right fit for us.
We have complex healthcare workflows and business processes that may not be compatible with Whatfix.
We are concerned about the security and compliance of our patient data with Whatfix.
We are not sure if Whatfix will be able to provide the level of customization we need for our healthcare operations.
We have had bad experiences with digital adoption platforms in the past, and we're not sure if Whatfix will be different.

messages.content: Hi, this is [Whatfix Sales Person] from Whatfix. Thank you for taking the time to speak with me today, [Cardinal Health Team]. Could you please start by telling me a little bit about your role and responsibilities at Cardinal Health?

Hi, thank you for having me. I'm [Name], and I'm the Director of IT Operations at Cardinal Health. My team and I are responsible for implementing and managing technology solutions to improve patient care and reduce costs.

That's fascinating. I understand that Cardinal Health is a leading healthcare company, and I'm excited to learn more about your digital adoption needs. What are some of the biggest challenges you're facing today in terms of technology adoption and user experience?

One of the biggest challenges we're facing is the complexity of our healthcare workflows and business processes. We have a lot of different systems and applications that our staff need to use, and it can be difficult to get them to adopt new technology quickly. We're also concerned about data security and compliance with healthcare regulations.

I completely understand. Digital adoption can be a significant challenge, especially in the healthcare industry where there are so many different systems and regulations to navigate. Can you tell me more about your current digital adoption strategy and what you're looking to achieve with a digital adoption platform like Whatfix?

Currently, we're using a combination of in-person training and online resources to help our staff learn new systems and applications. However, we're finding that it's not very effective, and we're not seeing the level of adoption that we need. We're looking for a solution that can provide personalized, in-app guidance to our users and help them learn new systems quickly and efficiently.

That makes sense. Whatfix is a digital adoption platform that provides personalized, in-app guidance to help users learn new systems quickly and efficiently. We've had a lot of success with healthcare companies in the past, and I think we could really help you achieve your digital adoption goals. Can you tell me more about your goals for implementing a digital adoption platform?

Our primary goal is to improve patient care and reduce costs. We're looking for a solution that can help us achieve those goals by increasing the adoption and proficiency of our staff on our healthcare systems and applications.

I completely understand. Whatfix can definitely help you achieve those goals. In terms of implementation, we typically recommend a phased approach, starting with a pilot project and then rolling out the solution more widely. We also provide a lot of support and training to ensure that your administrators and end-users are comfortable using the system.

That sounds like a good approach. We're also concerned about the security and compliance of our patient data with a digital adoption platform. Can you tell me more about Whatfix's approach to security and compliance?

Absolutely. Whatfix takes the security and compliance of our customers' data very seriously. We're HIPAA compliant, and we have a number of other security certifications and protocols in place to ensure the protection of sensitive data.

That's great to hear. We're also interested in understanding the ROI of using Whatfix for our digital adoption needs. Can you provide some information on the return on investment that your customers have seen?

Yes, of course. Our customers have seen a significant return on investment from using Whatfix. On average, our customers have seen a 30% reduction in training time and a 25% reduction in support requests. We've also had customers report a 20% increase in user adoption and proficiency.
Those are impressive numbers. What's the typical implementation timeline and resource requirements for Whatfix?

The implementation timeline and resource requirements for Whatfix can vary depending on the scope of the project and the complexity of the systems and applications involved. However, on average, our customers are up and running with Whatfix within 6-8 weeks, and we provide a lot of support and resources to ensure a smooth implementation.
That's helpful to know. We're also evaluating other digital adoption platforms, including WalkMe, Pendo, and Userpilot. How does Whatfix differentiate itself from these competitors?

Whatfix differentiates itself from competitors through its ease of use, flexibility, and scalability. We also provide a high level of customization and support to ensure that our customers are successful. Additionally, our pricing model is very competitive, and we offer a free trial and customized pricing plans to fit our customers' needs.
That's helpful to know. I think we've covered everything. Thank you for taking the time to speak with me today and for providing more information about Whatfix.

You're welcome, [Cardinal Health Team]. It was great speaking with you, and I'm looking forward to the opportunity to work with Cardinal Health. I'll follow up with you in a few days to answer any additional questions you may have and to discuss next steps.

features.name: Digital Adoption Platform
features.description: A no-code editor to create in-app guidance on any application that looks 100% native, providing personalized, in-app guidance to help users learn new systems quickly and efficiently.

features.name: Product Analytics
features.description: Advanced analytics and reporting capabilities to track user behavior and measure the effectiveness of digital adoption strategies.

features.name: In-app Guidance
features.description: Real-time, step-by-step guidance within the application to help users complete tasks quickly and accurately, reducing the need for expensive training and support.

features.name: User Onboarding
features.description: A streamlined onboarding process that gets users up and running quickly, with minimal disruption to their work.

features.name: Performance Support
features.description: Real-time, contextual support to help users overcome obstacles and achieve their goals, reducing the burden on support teams.

features.name: Security and Compliance
features.description: HIPAA compliance and robust security protocols to ensure the protection of sensitive patient data.

features.name: Implementation Timeline
features.description: A quick and efficient implementation timeline of 6-8 weeks, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations.

messages.content: Hello everyone, thank you for taking the time to join this demo call today. My name is [Name], and I'll be your salesperson for Whatfix. Before we begin, I just wanted to confirm that we have all the stakeholders involved from Cardinal Health's side. Can you please introduce yourselves and let me know who's on the call?

messages.user: Director of IT Operations, Cardinal Health
messages.content: Hi, I'm John, Director of IT Operations at Cardinal Health. We have our team leads from training, IT, and operations on the call as well. We're all interested in exploring how Whatfix can help us improve our digital adoption strategy.

Great, thank you for the introduction, John. Just to confirm, our goal for this demo is to showcase how Whatfix can help Cardinal Health address the complexity of healthcare workflows and business processes, as well as the difficulty in getting staff to adopt new technology quickly. We'll also be discussing data security and compliance with healthcare regulations.

messages.user: Director of IT Operations, Cardinal Health
messages.content: That's correct. We're looking for a solution that can help us streamline our workflows, improve user adoption, and ensure the security of our patient data.

Alright, let's dive into the demo. Whatfix offers a digital adoption platform that provides personalized, in-app guidance to help users learn new systems quickly and efficiently. Our platform is designed to be easy to use, with a no-code editor that allows you to create custom guidance for any application. I'll show you a live demo of how this works.

As you can see, our platform provides real-time, step-by-step guidance within the application, helping users complete tasks quickly and accurately. We've had a lot of success with healthcare companies in the past, and I think we could really help you achieve your digital adoption goals.
That looks really impressive. How do you handle data security and compliance? We have to ensure that our patient data is protected at all costs.

Thank you for bringing that up. Whatfix takes the security and compliance of our customers' data very seriously. We're HIPAA compliant, and we have a number of other security certifications and protocols in place to ensure the protection of sensitive data. I'd be happy to provide more information on our security features if you'd like.

In addition to our digital adoption platform, we also offer advanced analytics and reporting capabilities to track user behavior and measure the effectiveness of digital adoption strategies. This will help you identify areas for improvement and optimize your workflows.

messages.user: Director of IT Operations, Cardinal Health
messages.content: That sounds great. We're definitely interested in exploring how we can use analytics to improve our digital adoption strategy. Can you tell us more about your implementation timeline and resource requirements?

Our implementation timeline is typically 6-8 weeks, ensuring minimal disruption to your business operations. We've worked with several healthcare companies in the past, and we're confident we can help you achieve your goals quickly and efficiently.

I'd like to mention that we've had success with similar healthcare companies in the past, such as [similar company]. They were able to reduce their training time by 50% and improve user adoption by 30% within the first few months of using our platform.

We understand that every organization is unique, and we're happy to provide customizations or personalized features to address your specific pain points. Based on our discussion, I think we can offer some tailored solutions to help you achieve your goals.
Before we conclude, I'd like to ask, are there any other questions or concerns you have about our platform or how we can help you achieve your digital adoption goals?

messages.user: Director of IT Operations, Cardinal Health
messages.content: No, I think we've covered everything. Thank you for the demo, and we'll be in touch soon to discuss next steps.

You're welcome, John. It was a pleasure demoing our platform for you. We'll send over a follow-up email with some additional resources and information on our platform. Look forward to speaking with you soon.

messages.content: Hi Director of IT Operations and Training Team Lead from Cardinal Health, thank you for taking the time to discuss the pricing of our digital adoption platform. As we discussed during the demo, our platform can help you simplify healthcare workflows and improve staff adoption of new technology. I'd like to walk you through our pricing models and answer any questions you may have.

messages.user: Director of IT Operations, Cardinal Health
messages.content: Thank you for the overview. We're interested in understanding how your pricing works. Can you explain the different models you offer?

We offer three pricing models. Our most popular model is the Flat Fee + User License Fees, which is customized based on the application and number of users. We also have a Free Plan, which includes 30 credits and is suitable for small-scale use. Additionally, we have a Basic Plan starting at $39 per month. All of our plans are available on a yearly or monthly basis.
We're concerned about the security and compliance of patient data. Can you assure us that your platform meets HIPAA requirements?

I completely understand your concern. Whatfix takes the security and compliance of our customers' data very seriously. We're HIPAA compliant, and we have a number of other security certifications and protocols in place to ensure the protection of sensitive data. I'd be happy to provide more information on our security features if you'd like.

messages.user: Director of IT Operations, Cardinal Health
messages.content: That's good to hear. We're working with a budget of $50,000 for this project. Do you have a plan that can fit within that range?

I think we can definitely work within your budget. Our Flat Fee + User License Fees model is customizable, so we can tailor a plan to fit your needs and budget. I'd recommend our Basic Plan, which starts at $39 per month, and we can adjust the user license fees to fit within your $50,000 budget.
We're looking to implement this solution within the next 6-8 weeks. Can you accommodate that timeline?
Yes, we can definitely work within that timeline. Our implementation process is typically completed within 6-8 weeks, and we'll work closely with your team to ensure a smooth deployment.

messages.user: Director of IT Operations, Cardinal Health
messages.content: We're interested in the Flat Fee + User License Fees model. Can you provide more details on what that entails?

The Flat Fee + User License Fees model is our most popular model. The flat fee is a one-time payment for the application, and the user license fees are monthly or yearly payments based on the number of users. This model provides a high degree of flexibility and scalability, and we can customize it to fit your specific needs.
What are the key performance indicators (KPIs) we should use to measure the success of this solution?

We've found that our customers typically measure success based on metrics such as user adoption rates, time-to-competency, and reduction in training time. We can work with you to establish KPIs that are specific to your organization and goals.

messages.user: Director of IT Operations, Cardinal Health
messages.content: Our company's financial priorities are focused on reducing costs and improving patient care. How does your solution align with those priorities?

Our solution is specifically designed to help healthcare organizations like yours reduce costs and improve patient care. By simplifying healthcare workflows and improving staff adoption of new technology, we've seen our customers achieve significant cost savings and improvements in patient care. I'd be happy to provide some case studies that demonstrate the ROI of our solution.

I'd like to summarize the discussion we've had today. We've discussed our pricing models, and I believe our Flat Fee + User License Fees model is the best fit for your organization. We've addressed your concerns about security and compliance, and we've established a timeline for implementation. Is there anything else you'd like to discuss or any next steps you'd like to take?

messages.user: Director of IT Operations, Cardinal Health
messages.content: I think we've covered everything. We'll review the information you've provided and get back to you within the next week to discuss next steps.
That sounds great. I'll follow up with you in a week to discuss next steps. Thank you again for considering Whatfix, and I look forward to the opportunity to work with you.

messages.content: Hi, this is [Whatfix Representative] from Whatfix. I hope you're doing well. I wanted to follow up on our previous discussions regarding the implementation of our digital adoption platform at Cardinal Health. We've had a chance to review your requirements, and I'm excited to discuss how we can help you achieve your digital adoption goals.

Hi, thanks for reaching out. We're still interested in moving forward with the implementation, but we do have some concerns that we'd like to address. Specifically, we're still worried about the security and compliance of patient data. Can you reassure us that your platform is secure and compliant with healthcare regulations?

Absolutely. I completely understand your concerns. Whatfix takes the security and compliance of our customers' data very seriously. We're HIPAA compliant, and we have a number of other security certifications and protocols in place to ensure the protection of sensitive data. We'd be happy to provide more information on our security features and protocols if you'd like.

That's good to hear. We'd also like to know who else will be involved in the decision-making process. We have our Director of IT Operations and Training Team Lead who will be evaluating the solution. Will you be working directly with them?

Yes, I'll be working closely with both the Director of IT Operations and the Training Team Lead to ensure that our solution meets your needs. I'll be providing them with regular updates and demoing our platform to ensure they're comfortable with the implementation. We've had success with similar healthcare companies in the past, and I'm confident we can do the same for Cardinal Health.
Okay, that sounds good. We're also concerned about the procurement process and contract terms. Can you walk us through what that will look like?

Certainly. We offer a flexible, scalable solution that can be tailored to fit your needs. In terms of contract terms, we typically offer a Flat Fee + User License Fees model, which aligns with your budget of $50,000 for this project. We're also happy to provide discounts and concessions to address any concerns you may have. Can you tell me more about your specific procurement concerns?

Well, we're looking to implement this solution within the next 6-8 weeks, so we'll need to move quickly. We're also concerned about the ROI of the solution. Can you provide some case studies or data on the cost savings and improvements in patient care that we can expect?

Yes, we've had similar healthcare companies achieve significant ROI with our solution. For example, [similar company] was able to reduce their training time by 50% and improve user adoption by 30% within the first few months of using our platform. We can provide you with more detailed case studies and ROI calculators to help you understand the value of our solution. In terms of implementation, we're confident we can meet your timeline of 6-8 weeks. We'll work closely with your team to ensure a smooth implementation process.

Okay, that sounds good. We're willing to move forward with the implementation, but we'd like to request a discount on the overall price. Can you provide us with a customized proposal that takes into account our budget and procurement concerns?

I completely understand. I'm happy to provide a customized proposal that addresses your concerns. Based on our previous discussions, I'm confident we can provide a solution that fits within your budget of $50,000. I'll work with our team to provide a revised proposal that includes discounts and concessions. We'll also provide a detailed implementation plan and timeline to ensure a smooth rollout. I'll have this proposal to you by the end of the week. Does that sound acceptable?
Yes, that sounds good. We're looking forward to reviewing the proposal and moving forward with the implementation.

Great. I'll have the proposal to you by the end of the week. In the meantime, I'll be available to answer any further questions you may have. Thank you for considering Whatfix for your digital adoption needs. I'm confident we can help you achieve your goals and improve patient care.
